member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Validation.Integration.WinForms.ValidationProvider
member.summary: Provides a mechanism to specify automatic or user requested validation for controls.
member.remarks:
This component is an extender provider that adds properties to controls that allow the designer of the application to specify how to validate the controls' values using the Validation Application Block.
Validation can be automatic through the event, or initiated via code by invoking the method; in both cases the control needs to have been properly configured through the validation provider.
An instance of can be specified for the component; in this case the validation errors resulting from validating a control are set on the error provider as a properly formatted error message for the control.
A validation provider can be enabled or disabled through the property. When it is disabled no validation will occur and the validaton provider will be considered valid, and any error messages posted to the will be cleared. If re-enabled, it will continue to be valid and no error messages will be posted until validation is triggered again.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Validation.Integration.WinForms.ValidationProvider.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Validation.Integration.WinForms.ValidationProvider.PerformValidation(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Invokes the validation process for a control.
member.remarks: This method allows for programmatic invocation of the validation process. The control needs to be already configured for validation with the validation provider through the extender properties.
member.exception: when is not registered with the validation provider by specifying the extended properties.
when the has not been specified or is invalid.
when the source property name for the control to validate has not been specified or is invalid.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Validation.Integration.WinForms.ValidationProvider.IsValid
member.summary: Gets an indication of whether the values for the controls managed by the have been successfully validated.
member.value: when the values for all the managed controls have been successfully validated; otherwise.
member.remarks: This property reflects the outcome of validations that were performed, so if there is a managed control with an invalid value for which validation has not been performed the value for this property might be .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Validation.Integration.WinForms.ValidationProvider.ValidationResultFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the format to use when formatting validation results to post to an .
member.remarks:
The value is a standard string formatting template. The supplied format items are:
{0}The message.
{1}The key.
{2}The tag.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Validation.Integration.WinForms.ValidationProvider.Enabled
member.summary: The indication of whether the will perform validations.
member.remarks:
No validation will be performed if the is not enabled, even when requested through the method.
All existing errors will be cleared if set to , but will not be restated if set back to .
